abstract: Major crimes declined in New York City in 2014, continuing two-decade slide, with number of murders dropping to 328, lowest figure since at least 1963; New York Police Department is somber, however, after shooting deaths of two officers and bitter public struggle with Mayor Bill de Blasio over fallout from grand jury decision not to indict officer involved in chokehold death of Eric Garner on Staten Island.
lead_paragraph: In the week since two patrolmen were shot dead, police officers have cut back on policing minor offenses — yet reported crimes still fell.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

snippet: In the week since two patrolmen were shot dead, police officers have cut back on policing minor offenses — yet reported crimes still fell.

headline.main: Murders in New York Drop to a Record Low, but Officers Aren’t Celebrating
headline.print_headline: Murders Drop to a Record Low, but Officers Aren’t Celebrating
